main event: A Navy aircraft reported an unidentified flying object sighting over the Pacific Ocean on January 6, 1960.
interesting points: The object was described as a very bright light with irregular edges, about half the size of a full moon., The sighting lasted for 12 seconds., An aircraft commander estimated the size of the object to be about 30 to 40 feet in diameter., The report suggested that the object was possibly a balloon., The sighting involved multiple naval personnel who observed and reported the incident.
sighted object: very bright light with irregular edges
witness description: Navy personnel including a copilot and other crew members.
